item.title: Adaptive Planning
Gestione dello stress: quando un DEV incontra la Mindfulness
Morire è un po' rinascere
item.description: I post-mortem e come abbiamo gestito i nostri: partire dalla cronaca dei fatti partecipazione di tutte le persone coinvolte umiltà, ascolto e creatività per approfondire e trovare le cause e le soluzioni un contesto che non colpevolizza il singolo e mette sotto accusa processi e strumenti

item.title: Public speaking for geeks: how to rock the stage!
item.description: Speaking in public is not easy, especially for geeks, that tend to be too technical, or too shy, or too something… In this session, we’ll start with some basic tips, and we’ll see how to dramatically improve our results using well-defined techniques. We’ll also see (with practical examples) how to deal with problems during speeches, elevator pitches, product presentations, interviews, and so on. Public speaking skills are not useful to conference speakers only, everybody needs to improve them, especially geeks!

item.title: To be a "Professional Team Player"
item.description: Every developer wanna be The Hero ™, right?! Everybody likes to stand under the spotlight and “be recognized”! Well, I Do! But over time I’ve learnt that being a “Professional” is harder than being “The Hero”; and being a “Professional Team Player” is even harder! Looking at my own failures, these are the things I do to improve myself, to be a better “Professional”, to be a better “Team Player”.
